Description: Fragment of an open vessel (cup/bowl?) in translucent deep blue and opaque white cameo glass. The decoration, in white, shows an Egyptianising scene. A reed boat decorated with two rosettes is being driven by a figure of which the right foot and part of an ankle-length garment survives. A pole is shown diagonally across the boat and in the water. The foot of a companion is visible to the left behind the punter. Underneath, to the right, is a lotus pod.
Bibliographic references: Sangiorgi 1914 / Collezione di Vetri Antichi dalle Origini al V sec. D C: Ordinati e descritti (no. 157)
Tatton-Brown et al 2007 / Roman Cameo Glass (24)
Roberts et al 2010 / Roman Cameo Glass in the British Museum (24)
Glass 2 / Catalogue of Greek and Roman Glass, Volume 2 (750)
Acquisition notes: Sold at Christie's New York 3 June 1999, Lot 137 (part) with 1999.8-3.1. Then purchased through Charles Ede.
